Sentence: At once, the organist, Pistorius, takes a great interest in Sinclair
Pistorius becomes a mentor to Sinclair, helping him (Pistorius) to learn further things about himself and teaching him (Pistorius) a bit about Abraxas
Sinclair begins to see that Pistorius has limitations
(he)', 'He (Pistorius) brings Pistorius to recognize that he (Pistorius) can only teach Sinclair about old gods and ideas of the past--he (Pistorius) is not creative enough to invent new ones
Their relationship ends as Sinclair ends his (Pistorius) time at preparatory school
